fields.Name: recFBRePgXKkiq5r6,rec1mGcDGgMvv2pxX
fields.Startup (from Startup):
1. Co-build with partners: continue developing the product closely with end-customers and interim agency partners, ensuring their feedback directly shapes the roadmap.
2. Expand pipeline: actively engage and activate new opportunities, with a strong focus on acquiring and nurturing end-customer relationships.
3. Onboard our new CTO, Adriel, and start to work closely with him.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
Interim staffing agencies are highly interested in our solution because it helps them generate qualified leads, save time, and improve the relevance of their worker databases. On top of that, our model enables revenue-sharing opportunities through client placements.

For end-customers (companies in need of workers) our value goes beyond interim staffing. They want to collaborate with us not only for temporary workforce needs but also across the full spectrum of hiring processes: permanent contracts (CDI), fixed-term contracts (CDD), and potentially freelance engagements.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: We’re starting to see strong traction. Our biggest challenge now is prioritizing, focusing on the highest-value features we need to build first and doubling down on what truly moves the needle.

fields.Name: rectONLC61YtJmvN0,recECVBmDnBzslgbO
fields.Startup (from Startup):
- Send 2000 email invitations to add ava@avahome.fr directly. More than 50% of those outside France.
- Create a WhatsApp Community of Beta-testers, and ask them to refer 1 account each.
- Have SMS/WhatsApp plugged to the same level of reaction and reasoning as Airbnb/Booking
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
- About half of them are ready to pay for the product if they have Airbnb / Booking / WhatsApp
- Ava does not know how to handle the discussions around deposits in Booking 
- Ava does not have an accurate perception of time and that is creating a few confusing situations
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: - Clients need confidence before signing in to try the product. Confidence can be established by talking to them, but we have limited time.

fields.How can we help you ?: Connect us with someone experienced in consumer or Fintech apps
fields.How many active users do you have ?: None, still on problem and market analysis

fields.Startup (from Startup): Have a live marketplace
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
Real pain confirmed on both side :
- Demand : companies who work with blue collars worker need a better service (fast, simple, centralized, with high quality/trusted workers)
- Supply :
Small/indep temp‑staffing agencies view Jooob as a high‑value lead engine
Some medium networks want to work with us too.
If we send them leads, they can't refuse it for a long time => we think big network will be interested (we haven't discussed with them yet)

Demand with strong need/multi sites like the features : single invoice & follow-up with workers (=> build trust and long term relation with workers)
we ask ourself if we should launch the third user in our platform now (worker) or if we should stay on only final customers + agencies.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: lack of time, summer.

fields.How can we help you ?: Be nice with us at the Pre-IC/IC ? Hahahaha

fields.Name: recHx5khDcNw6mQJU,recuqVu5yHzofeALq
fields.Startup (from Startup):
Be prepared for the pre IC. Top focus
Re opening the frozen client discussions of August.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee: They are all getting back from holidays. I am trying to identify if my selling path is optimal. Today I mostly come through sales/partnership officers for them to be my internal sponsor and lead me to head of legal. Now I am trying to make the head of legal my primary contact and the internal sponsor. I am also preparing a test for Procurement officers.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
The pain is so huge that some companies are already trying to solve it (are currently in process) with buying existing solutions. They all say the same: these solutions are far from ideal, not solving all their issues but just a tiny bit and ours is better, but as they are already in process, they need to finish the process before having the possibility to work with us. 

That s also our biggest strength, as for example we signed our pilot on one decisive call because everyone has and knows they have this big pain

fields.How can we help you ?: If you have any leads in real-estate, people selling apartments, particularly companies that are selling buildings that have not been built yet, please refer us.

fields.Startup (from Startup): Reach out to 25 new people. Got 5 new demo planned.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
SaaS platforms, even big, might work with no classical legal frame. In startup mode, taking much risks. For example, a major international ERP we talked to this week has no proper legal team even if they have 7K employees worldwide. 

On the positive side, we got 4 emails of proof of interest this week. People love what we are building.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: August and long sales cycles. We also need a good timing. For example Alstom legal loved our tool but they are in transition to another CRM right now and they don't think they have the bandwidth for a pilot in the coming weeks.

fields.How can we help you ?: Get a one-to-one with Hugo or Maxime to discuss creativity of GTM

fields.Name: rec7BYeJHPUbDtD44,recwJxcDvm8e0gjn3,recZE4fXnvq3G58il
fields.Startup (from Startup):
Define MVP criteria, start building the technology
Reach out to 20 lenders
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee: Banks assess loan applications by reviewing the applicant’s financial situation, including income, existing obligations, employment history, and credit records from public registers and credit bureaus. Applicants are typically required to provide identification and proof of income, with identity verification sometimes completed through a small bank transfer or mobile signature. Based on this assessment, the bank determines creditworthiness and offers a personalized interest rate reflecting the applicant’s financial position. Most loans do not require collateral or guarantors, but stable income and a reasonable debt-to-income ratio are generally expected. Decisions are often issued quickly, ranging from a few minutes to one business day.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Slow pace during August in Europe

fields.How can we help you ?: Review of our status and strategy to build the company
fields.How many active users do you have ?: 0 - 1 signed client but no launch yet

fields.What have you learned from your users ?: - Clients require a lot of education before plugging Ava and that is very time-consuming. Getting them to plug Ava without talking to a sales is our challenge

fields.How can we help you ?: Connect us with a strategic partner (insurer, mutual fund, or HR platform like Worklife…)
fields.How many active users do you have ?:
Equans Group reached out spontaneously to deploy Go Fusion in one of their departments
The deal is small (€2,000), but it shows natural traction
Internal word-of-mouth is working, confirming both the demand and value of our solution

fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
- They expect a simple, personalized, and actionable experience
- The gamified aspect is appreciated, but they mainly seek real impact on their well-being and carbon footprint
- Our AI engine, which automatically generates content based on weak signals, is seen as a strong value-add: it saves time and increases relevance
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
- Industrializing our predictive AI technology
- Structuring a strategic partnership with an insurer

fields.How can we help you ?: Introduction with CTOs and tech leaders. Does this really work,  I don't see any benefit from posting here since last week :P

There is a WOW effect when I show the demo in person.
There is a new angle I found, startups that are reaching certain kind of scale are thinking to move cost-effective deployment/monitoring tools like Render to DataDog because they want to debug with better context view that DataDog provides. This helped me with a key insight that could help position my product uniquely. I cannot disclose more here.

fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
- What people love: Reactivity, reliability and politeness
- About half of them are not ready yet to leave Ava 'do her job'. They interfere with her and it has counterproductive results. We need to progress on reactivity and reliability before they stop monitoring the chat and see the value of our product
- Human-sized concierge services want to keep a 'human touch', asking for a friendlier tone (Au Dodo, Léa LuckyHost)
- Many conciergeries are franchised and that's a great way to spread quickly
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Our infrastructure is not reliable enough yet so we spend a lot of time monitoring the chat/fixing bugs. We need to tune the inflow of new users/clients with our capacity.

NA

fields.Startup (from Startup):
We’ve defined three positioning options for Go Fusion (as a CSR tool, a training solution, or an engagement platform). Our goal is to choose one clear positioning in order to:

- Redesign the website
- Update the data room accordingly
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee: Go Fusion addresses several markets, but we need to be clear in our value proposition.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
The sales process is long because our target customers are large corporations. We first need to present the product, then run a pilot, validate the results in a steering committee, and only then can we move to large-scale deployment.

However, once the pilot is completed, cross-selling and up-selling become much easier—both within subsidiaries in France and internationally.

fields.Startup (from Startup):
- Pilot Launch Preparation: Finalize roadmap and onboarding process for Crowdstrike pilot starting September 1st, ensuring seamless customer experience and clear success metrics
- Frontend Architecture Migration: Rebuild current Lovable frontend using Svelte for improved adaptability, performance, and maintainability
- Data Intelligence Enhancement: Optimize document processing pipeline to improve information extraction quality and accuracy for government intelligence feeds
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
Resource Constraints & Manual Work (Crowdstrike)
- Tech companies have minimal resources for government monitoring, relying on heavy manual processes to track opportunities, budgets and contract cycles
- Signal of potential daily usage
- €250 pilot fee accepted immediately for September 1st start, feedback call before planned

Role-Based Feature Demand (AWS)
- Big Tech sees tool relevance across entire gov sales org with role-specific needs: Capture Managers (expiring contracts), SDRs (decision maker data), Account Managers (entity relationship views)
- Limited satisfaction with tender software by legacy market leader - "Your software seems so much more intuitive"

GovTech Startup Differentiation (Tucan.ai - (Granola with GDPR))
- Small challengers and GovTech startups appreciate different features than large tech companies, focusing more on operational efficiency and workflow automation
- Wide variety in how GovTech startups use tools, from protocol automation to specialized local government workflows
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Priorization

fields.How can we help you ?: Introductions to banks/fintechs are always welcome.
fields.How many active users do you have ?: We have 3 LOIs.
fields.Name: rec7BYeJHPUbDtD44,recwJxcDvm8e0gjn3,recZE4fXnvq3G58il
fields.Startup (from Startup):
Finalize the pitch deck, entry target markets and customer segments.
More LOIs signed.
Technology base done.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
We’ve gained a deeper understanding of the problem and validated our solution. Of the three fintechs that agreed to sign an LOI, two focus on lending to individuals and one on SMEs. This prompted us to consider whether it’s more strategic to build a risk valuation solution tailored to individuals or SMEs.

Additionally, one of these fintechs operates in Colombia while the other two are based in Europe. Upon further research into the LatAm market, we found it to be highly favorable for this type of solution due to lighter regulations. At the same time, Mexico, Brazil, and Chile have adopted PSD2-like directives that underpin open banking, the very technology we use to build our product.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Our biggest obstacle continues to be long contract cycles with the banks. On the other hand, from the 3 LOIs that we have revenue potential is €325.000 in ARR.

fields.How can we help you ?: We’d love support reviewing our pitch materials and feedback on how to simplify our messaging. Also open to intros to logistics operators with >30 drivers or >1,000 parcels/day ...especially in France or Germany.

fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Navigating long sales cycles.

Strategic partnerships with banks & fintechs
Connecting us to someone who has successfully implemented a strategy to acquire customers (the C segment of our business model)
fields.How many active users do you have ?:
We have contacted 32 lenders and loan comparison portals in the past week. We are still at 3 LOIs, mainly due to being summer and people are slow at replying.

The 3 LOIs = €325.000 in projected ARR (conservative approach)
fields.Name: recZE4fXnvq3G58il,recwJxcDvm8e0gjn3,rec7BYeJHPUbDtD44
fields.Startup (from Startup):
1. Reaching out via LinkedIn Sales Navigator to CXOs in Eastern and northern Europe
2. Finalize pitch deck + materials
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
We have clearly defined our target markets and customer segments. Our primary focus is on expanding into Eastern Europe, where there is strong demand for loans but limited access through traditional banks due to higher perceived customer risk. Additionally, we’ve identified Latin America as an attractive market, as the presence of PSD2-equivalent regulations means we can scale our technology with minimal adaptation.

We will target individuals aged 18–29, particularly freelancers and gig workers which are the segments often underserved due to limited available financial data, which complicates traditional credit scoring. Our conversations with banks and credit rating agencies confirm that this is a pressing challenge, and our solution directly addresses their needs.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Our biggest obstacle continues to be slow sales cycle. However, it does not discourages us as the contracts are much larger. One contract could go as far as €1m in revenue.

fields.How can we help you ?: Happy to do a meeting to challenge our Distribution strategy

fields.Name: recmWjRA5A3dYT8P8,rec1jwsAl6dhrtLFz
fields.Startup (from Startup):
1.) De-risk team for tech
2.) De-risk business case, solidify our business model
3.) Make it through selection day
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee: It is nice to have the visual agents do sales, but they do not solve the root problem. The root problem for the luxury development group is to find the client willing to pay €30M for a mansion. The problem for the family company that owns a real estate portfolio is the back and forth between getting answers from different actors to buy an asset. The problem for the construction site is to sell the renders of a project they have yet to sell. At the end of the day, the visual agents are a tool to maximize sales and fluidity, but the real need has to do with the actual hardships of each actor. The key is to develop a solution that makes it seamless for them to do their job. 0
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Defining use case of tech to solve the real problem we are facing, make sure that the tech is there to make it happen.

Introductions to fintechs or microlenders.

fields.Name: recZE4fXnvq3G58il,recwJxcDvm8e0gjn3,rec7BYeJHPUbDtD44
fields.Startup (from Startup):
On the business development side: Secure 1-2 LOIs from either banks, fintechs or microlenders.
On the technology side: Research into Open Banking and how to structure MVP.
On the fundraising side: Calls with 2 VCs scheduled for this week.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
In the last week we spoke to 1 online bank and 1 new fintech lender. We are testing which markets are the most promising markets to enter for us. We have concluded that Latam has big potential, there is a need for this kind of solution and the regulations are lower than in Europe. We are moving at a slower pace due to the fact that we are focused on reaching out to companies, rather than individuals. However, the response we got from lenders was positive and encouraging. It gave us confirmation that this indeed is a painpoint for them. 

The Austrian online bank we spoke to suggested that we speak to their software development company who provides them with their core banking solution. 

We also realized microlenders have a big need for credit risk solutions like ours. In Europe there are 69 of them (according to European Commission: https://ec.europa.eu/social/BlobServlet?docId=21452&langId=en) , mostly in Eastern Europe as people there can't apply for traditional loans in the banks.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: We are  moving slow -> but not due to us not moving the needle fast enough, it's mainly due to the type of customers we are talking to. Our customers are banks, fintechs and microlenders. Their decision making process is slow. On the flip side, the contracts are also much bigger and more expensive.

fields.Name: reclrnvOhKD5lwtIL,recekH0WQAEMk26vc
fields.Startup (from Startup):
1. Improve data processing and extraction mechanisms
2. Develop more concise user flows connecting different components of the product
(1.&2. relevant for closing pilot in scheduled follow up calls)
3. Testing segmentation, adjust messaging and observe conversions/ response rates.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
1. Large well established public sector sales teams have dedicated Account Executives for different regions and verticals. They are rather hesitant to talk about internal processes but they confirmed that processes we plan to automate on large scale are processed manually (eg. getting contract duration from awards notices).
2. Several users are paying agencies to monitor tenders. They are supposed to notify them about upcoming opportunities/ tenders.
3. Segmentation is key. As conditions for teams differ, focus on a sub segment with highest needs can allow moving faster. Currently assumed sweet spot: Companies with dedicated sales resources for public sector but not yet super established, e.g. international tech company or SMEs.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: User Interviews beyond network. Users reached out to via cold calls, especially in established of companies with established public sector strategies and resources,  are not very open to disclose information on internal processes. Segmentation and right messaging are likely to mitigate.

fields.How can we help you ?: Push back on our GTM strategy to help us find the right path forward
fields.Name: recSoqbOOhPAmI21u,rec0QhejQgLA8Fwhg
fields.Startup (from Startup): Get 10 paying design partners/customers for our AI agent for sales recruiting
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
- Hiring top sales talent is extremely hard—great salespeople rarely apply to job postings.
- Browser extensions are a blocker for larger companies due to IT restrictions.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Our biggest challenge is finding the right person to engage. Sales leaders and executives are flooded with LinkedIn messages, so it’s hard to break through. But going lower to AEs doesn’t work either since they’re not decision-makers and haven’t felt the pain of hiring top talent themselves.

fields.How can we help you ?: - We'd love a strategic brainstorm on our positioning and target audiences.
fields.Name: recAPE9yt0iJZVBA0,rec1LGBT5rBulQ00D
fields.Startup (from Startup):
- Decide whether or not to apply for the Qualiopi certification.
- Explore the “Osons l’IA” program (launched by the French Ministry of Digital Affairs to train all companies in AI), which aligns with what we're doing with Crédit Agricole.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
We met with Equans, Capital 8 (which hosts 10 companies), Crédit Agricole, Amundi, and Colas.
- CSR is a good entry point, but the needs go beyond that.
- Companies want to train their teams on responsible AI, mental and physical health, and many other topics depending on their strategy and key moments.
- They also want to foster synergy among employees and encourage a return to the office.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
- Finding the right positioning and market alignment.
- Are we a micro-learning platform? A tool for Chief Happiness Officers? A CSR solution?
- Should we offer ready-to-use thematic “bundles” clients can activate freely?
- The good news: Go Fusion remains the same product — it's fully customizable and can integrate any theme.

fields.How can we help you ?: Can you please include Enoc into the slack (aensilesqla@gmail.com), update our startup into this doc ¨VUEN AI¨ is the name. Any criticism on our deck for the moment (not finished) is welcome (https://app.pitch.com/app/player/4644e9c5-0bc0-42ca-920e-e072ca17ba27/6bdefcd1-38e0-4573-9af8-5015d30c54a2/c1636b5c-86d4-46a8-b16d-0e8a636b9da9) Happy to hear feedback.

fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee: Interest for the tech, but not sure how it brings value today. Users are scared to implement with current active users because it could entail losing customers. We need to demonstrate results of success without hurting their current revenue.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: We need to speak to as many possible users to determine which is the vertical we have to focus on. The only way we will be able to compete properly is by focusing on a vertical where we can get as much possible data to build a moat. How to define the correct vertical is our biggest obstacle.

fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
a lot of small agencies are based on papers or very manual processes.
A lot of people in this industry think that AI will replace ~80% of manual processes (pov shared by legacy agency Manpower, and owner of small agencies).
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
It was to define exactly what pain we want to solve in the blue-collar hiring market.
Now, after deep market discovery, we know exactly where to start: AI-powered talent pool that hires in minutes for staffing agencies.
This positioning resolve a huge pain for staffing agencies and enable us to be on the field to have multiple next-steps opportunities along the value chain.

Also, a personal issue, Jules, the CEO, was attacked on the street and hospitalized, which had an impact on the business development planned for last week. He's back to close the first batch of clients before the IC!

fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:

• A strategic announcement is coming: partnership with an insurance player to launch a new preventive model (well-being + climate).

fields.Name: recEOHF4Z0BmZq56C,recnO8Mn6MVb3cpzM
fields.Startup (from Startup):
- More interviews.
- Refining the roadmap of the product.
- building a new UI for students in France.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
There's a need for tools specialised for Legal Research. It's hard to gather the data from various sources, reduce noice. Etc.

Here's an interview with a licensed attorney and a Partner in California:


Most valuable resources are going to be your secondary source materials. New lawyers want research to come easy and they don't want to go through law journals
You may find something that doesn't even apply to your state or jurisdiction so it's useless.

Smaller law firms don't want to pay to access databases, It becomes too costly, So they're using google. Google can be helpful when you're starting to map your research but often times you need more specific information and that's where a database comes in handy
Large firms just pass the cost on to their clients.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
Conducting interview with USa Legal Professional, lawyers, attorneys, judges. Their billable hours are huge, it's hard to receive feedback for free.

Penetrating US Market.

Relying on students alone make the revue seasonal. We are trying to pivot and target legal professionals at scale.

fields.How can we help you ?: Introduction to people working in the intérim/blue collars market.

fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
They are more under-digitized than expected, with a lot of paperwork. This can actually be a good thing, because AI enables us to leap from being under-digitized directly to AI outputs for them.
Some are embracing AI, some other are totally against.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: French holidays.

Staffing agencies seems to need AI on pre-vetting + database updating.
Need AI on pre-matching.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
We onboarded Tomas 1week ago, decided to take a step back to overview all the market.
Then decided to focus on the most ambitious play possible.
Focusing on US, to build a worker database + AI microservices on top of that to serve de blue collars economy.

fields.Name: recSt2IAYyrlpGH9W,recuCYxmlOQvGuFM1
fields.Startup (from Startup):
Build the MVP that demonstrates true value to customers, they are happy to pay for the result.
We want to focus on 2 pilot customers and not sell more because the problems got validated by multiple potential customers, what they want to see is a real product. So we do the pilot gather learnings, and go all in with distribution to waitlisted and other potential customers in our network.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee: Faster root cause analysis the most painful point that they want us to solve fast but it has automation pre-requisites that we need to do as part of onboarding.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
Less time, more to do. What we demonstrated was a working prototype but our MVP is technically complicated and we need to prove the value to customers before charging them because our MVP's main proposition is to reduce Mean Time To Resolution for incidents and its technically hard challenge and product development will take time.
We are solving a hard problem and it could take more time with current members.

fields.How can we help you ?: All good

fields.How can we help you ?: - If you have any thoughts or advice on distribution strategy, especially around targeting the right personas or company profiles, we would love to hear them. Attached is a breakdown of our current strategy.

fields.Name: recSoqbOOhPAmI21u,rec0QhejQgLA8Fwhg
fields.Startup (from Startup): - Make meaningful progress on distribution by identifying ideal customer profiles and refining our outreach strategy.
fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
- Keeping the candidate database in the ATS up to date is a major pain point for users.
- Users find it critical to automatically update candidate profiles with answers from screening and interview questions.
fields.What have you learned from your users ?:
- Identifying the right point of contact within a company is still a challenge — we’re exploring whether engineering managers, HR leadership, or other stakeholders are the best entry point.
- We are also still determining the right type of company to target. Newer, fast-scaling companies offer a quicker feedback loop and higher candidate volume, while more established businesses typically have older ATS systems where our solution can provide greater value.

fields.What are your top 1-3 goals for next wee:
Enterprise segment highly relevant: Several use cases of product for different positions in a public sector sales team confirmed in a conversation with AWS

Different features SMEs & Enterprise: Both segments see value in the product but it's bit of a balance act which segment to prioritize as they ask for different features - take from office hour: be opportunistic 

Competitor Screening & Conversations - what others do: either focus on specific niches and limited feature scope or raise a lot of capital
fields.What have you learned from your users ?: Messaging: Refining value proposition specific to different target groups
